In the J2EE Perspective, I imported a 1.1 EJB with Ear and Client jar.  Then I expanded the project Explorer and right clicked on the entity beans node and created a new CMP according to the first CMP created in EJBCRTWIZ02

I cannot reproduce the problem in WTP build, but looking at the code, NPE is from 

JavaClassImpl.isExistingType(JavaClassImpl.java:984)

The only way this can occur is if someone holding onto a JavaClassImpl for a project that has been closed or deleted. Please verify that that is not the case. The way it can be told is at the time of the error look at the following calls against the JavaClass.

javaClass.eResource() should be not null. If it is null then the project has been closed/deleted.

if eResource() is not null, then eResource().getResourceSet() is not null. If it is null then the project has been closed/deleted.

If the java class is from a project that has been closed/deleted then this is an error in validation code and needs to be corrected. If the project is not closed/deleted then it is a JEM error.

It may also have been turned into a proxy.

javaclass.eIsProxy() is true if it was. That would also be typically due to a project being closed or deleted.
Neeraj, can you comment on this defect?  Can it even be reproduced anymore?
No, i can never reproduce this.
Let's close this as unreproducible for now.
